channel.title: Lagex PHP Services
channel.description:
[center][size=30pt]Lagex's PHP Services[/size][/center]
Table Of Content
[ul][li]Image Hosting[/li]
[li]G-Mail Dynamic Sig[/li][/ul]
[hr] [size=14pt]Image Uploading[/size] [center]http://www.lagex.net/upload/[/center] This is a free image uploading service. Ive just cleaned out all of my files in my hosting and though, Well what am i going to do with all this space?? Well Lagex Image Upload. Is alot like Imageshack. But you will wonder. Why not just use Imageshack? The Fact is. My image service is Faster and Supports 1548000 KB (1.5MB) Were as Imageshack Only Supports 1000000 KB (1.0MB). I Properly will Upgrade it to 2.5MB Sometime because i have 4.5GB left that im not using :rolleyes: This is an example if you show your friends: http://www.lagex.net/upload/v.php?id=10212mickthomsonslipknotur1.png Its got the same setup as ImageShack too :) So Feel Free to use. :) [hr] [size=14pt]Lag-IP[/size] http://ip.lagex.net [hr] [size=14pt]G-Mail Sig Generator[/size] Well i have made this Gmail Dymaic Siggy System [b]USAGE[/b] http://www.lagex.net/gmail Type your User name then pick the image you want [b]-OR-[/b] For image 1: http://www.lagex.net/gmail/gmail1/gmail.php?user=example For image2: http://www.lagex.net/gmail/gmail2/gmail.php?user=example For image3: http://www.lagex.net/gmail/gmail3/gmail.php?user=example [hr] Check Back for more :) Updating Everyday ;)

item.title: Lagex PHP Services
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:52, topic:71294”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=104798.msg1060753#msg1060753 date=1175127825]
This may help you:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/ip.php

[code=php]<?php
echo ’

IP - '.$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'].' Your IP is '.$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'].'
Your User-Agent is '.$_SERVER['HTTP_USER_AGENT'].' '; ?>[/code]

Google is your friend, that is how I learned all the php and most of the java I know.
[/quote]
Mopar, sorry if I’m off topic, but whats the difference between PHP and HTML? Cause isnt there a program calld Nvu that like designs a page?[/quote]

PHP is a programming language (mainly used for scripting) that you can use to dynamically generate HTML by acting on the inputs given to it. HTML is simply a markup language that tells your browser how to layout things visually.

Read full topic
